Always keep documentation up to date and provide extensive documentation of the code in the source. 
Make sure test coverage is sufgicient. Always cover new functionality be tests. 
When writing markdown documentation always surround headings, lists amd fences blocks with blank lines. 
When writing code snippets in markdown always use fenced code blocks with the appropriate language tag. 
When writing bash code snippets always use bash as the language tag. 
When writing python code snippets always use python as the language tag.
Anytime single source code file exceeds 300 lines of code consider refactoring it into smaller modules.
When writing commit messages always follow the Conventional Commits specification (https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/).
When writing commit messages always include a brief description of the change, the motivation behind it, and any relevant issue numbers.
When writing commit messages for bug fixes always include steps to reproduce the bug if applicable.
When writing commit messages for new features always include usage examples if applicable.
When writing commit messages for refactoring always include the reasoning behind the refactor.
When writing commit messages for documentation updates always include a summary of the changes made.
When writing commit messages for tests always include a description of what is being tested.
